reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: The road ahead: evaluating road impacts and developing a framework for sustainable wildlife harvests by extractive industries in Guyana

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Category, when applicable and appropriate.

This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes The purpose of this project is to build on the success and needs identified in the 2014-2015 USFWS-funded project on hunting sustainability in Guyana which to date has resulted in the Ministry of Natural Resources and the Environment of Guyana establishing a Wildlife Management Steering Committee to direct the application of the project results in national wildlife policy and implementation. The current project will establish a framework for the regulation of forestry and mining activities to prevent the overharvest of wildlife, raise public awareness of Guyana’s legislation on wildlife harvest and trade, build a foundation for incorporating forestry and mining stations into the wildlife reporting system, and increase national capacity of wildlife management units..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Fish and Wildlife Service/Office of International Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Guyana's economic growth, resulting from the expansion of its mining sectors, has not resulted in improved social and political development indicators. Challenges to Guyana's development persist, including weak infrastructure, deficiencies in its anti-money laundering and anti-terrorist financing regime, persistent crime, limited law enforcement capacity, drug trafficking, continued out-migration, and the ongoing threat from the HIV/AIDS epidemic. U.S. assistance to Guyana focuses on strengthening democratic institutions, improving citizen security, combatting illicit trafficking, and mitigating the impact of the HIV/AIDS epidemic through the promotion of local, sustainable country programs. Regional programs will advance citizen security through the Caribbean Basin Security Initiative in order to complement and enhance U.S. bilateral assistance.
